title: Distressed Headline Font
content:
I need help identifying this distressed headline font. Any ideas?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Spicy Pickle Font.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130207035856/http:/typophile.com/files/Spicy%20Pickle%20Font_0.jpg) | 62.34 KB |
author: JanetBegre

comments.content:
It's interesting that the sample has three P's and one doesn't match the other two. The only other repeated letters (I) are identical. So this is a font, but finding it is a problem, because it falls into the 'anyone could have made this' category of font design. You could scan through [Part 14 of the Script Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20130207035856/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/Script14Pg1.html) (Distressed Script), or look at Dafont (Brush) category.

- Mike Yanega

I just searched Dafont\> Script\> Brush, Trash and Various and didn't see it.

- Mike Yanega

I'm searching Part 14 of the Script Guide and see some similar looks, but no matches yet. Some alternatives: [Repent](http://web.archive.org/web/20130207035856/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?preadd=action&key=HAFO-REPE) by Harold Lohner and [Good Dog](http://web.archive.org/web/20130207035856/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fonthead/good-dog/) by Ethan Dunham.

- Mike Yanega

Still haven't had any luck finding this font, but the name may be Suspension. But I can't find where to purchase this font. Any ideas? Here is another sample

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130207035856im_/http:/typophile.com/files/index_05_new_5656.gif)

I can't find any font by that name. The lettering reminds me a little of the old Image Club font "Comic Book" See samples below:

- Mike Yanega

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130207035856im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ComicBookOneICG_6737.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130207035856im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ComicBookTwoICG_3628.gif)
